paragraph: CHAPTER XXIV. IRENE BEHAVES LIKE A PRINCESS
tokens: behave princess

paragraph: WHEN the princess awoke from the sweetest of sleeps, she found her nurse bending above her, the housekeeper looking over the nurse's shoulder, and the laundry-maid looking over the housekeeper's. The room was full of women-servants; and the gentlemen-at-arms, with a long column of men-servants behind them, were peeping, or trying to peep in at the door of the nursery.
tokens: princess awoke sweetest sleep find nurse bending housekeeper look nurse shoulder laundry maid look housekeeper room full woman servant gentleman arm long column men-servant peep try peep door nursery

paragraph: "Are those horrid creatures gone?" asked the princess, remembering first what had terrified her in the morning.
tokens: horrid creature gone ask princess remember first terrify morning

paragraph: "You naughty little princess!" cried Lootie.
tokens: naughty little princess cry

paragraph: Her face was very pale, with red streaks in it, and she looked as if she were going to shake her; but Irene said nothing--only waited to hear what should come next.
tokens: face pale red streak look go shake say wait hear come

paragraph: "How _could_ you get under the clothes like that, and make us all fancy you were lost! And keep it up all day too! You _are_ the most obstinate child! It's anything but fun to us, I can tell you!"
tokens: get clothes make fancy lose keep day _are obstinate child fun tell

paragraph: It was the only way the nurse could account for her disappearance.
tokens: only way nurse account disappearance

paragraph: "I didn't do that, Lootie," said Irene, very quietly.
tokens: do say

paragraph: "Don't tell stories!" cried her nurse quite rudely.
tokens: tell story cry nurse

paragraph: "I shall tell you nothing at all," said Irene.
tokens: tell say

paragraph: "That's just as bad," said the nurse.
tokens: bad say nurse

paragraph: "Just as bad to say nothing at all as to tell stories!" exclaimed the princess. "I will ask my papa about that. He won't say so. And I don't think he will like you to say so."
tokens: bad say tell story exclaim princess ask papa say think like say

paragraph: "Tell me directly what you mean by it!" screamed the nurse, half wild with anger at the princess, and fright at the possible consequences to herself.
tokens: tell mean scream nurse half wild anger princess fright possible consequence

paragraph: "When I tell you the truth, Lootie," said the princess, who somehow did not feel at all angry, "you say to me _Don't tell stories_: it would appear that I must tell stories before you will believe me."
tokens: tell truth say princess feel angry say tell stories_ appear tell story believe

paragraph: "You are very rude, my dear princess," said the nurse.
tokens: rude dear princess say nurse

paragraph: "You are so rude, Lootie, that I will not speak to you again till you are sorry. Why should I, when I know you will not believe me?" returned the princess.
tokens: rude speak sorry know believe return princess

paragraph: For she did know perfectly well that if she were to tell Lootie what she had been about, the more she went on to tell her, the less would she believe her.
tokens: know tell more go tell less believe

paragraph: "You are the most provoking child!" cried her nurse. "You deserve to be well punished for your wicked behavior."
tokens: provoking child cry nurse deserve punish wicked behavior

paragraph: "Please, Mrs. Housekeeper," said the princess, "will you take me to your room and keep me till my king-papa comes? I will ask him to come as soon as he can."
tokens: say princess take room keep king papa come ask come

paragraph: Every one stared at these words. Up to this moment, they had all regarded her as little more than a baby.
tokens: one stare word moment regard little more baby

paragraph: But the housekeeper was afraid of the nurse, and sought to patch matters up, saying--
tokens: housekeeper afraid nurse seek patch matter say

paragraph: "I am sure, princess, nursey did not mean to be rude to you."
tokens: sure princess nursey mean rude

paragraph: "I do not think my papa would wish me to have a nurse who spoke to me as Lootie does. If she thinks I tell lies, she had better either say so to my papa, or go away. Sir Walter, will you take charge of me?"
tokens: think papa wish have nurse speak think tell lie have good say papa go take charge

paragraph: "With the greatest of pleasure, princess," answered the captain of the gentlemen-at-arms, walking with his great stride into the room. The crowd of servants made eager way for him, and he bowed low before the little princess's bed. "I shall send my servant at once, on the fastest horse in the stable, to tell your king-papa that your royal Highness desires his presence. When you have chosen one of these under-servants to wait upon you, I shall order the room to be cleared."
tokens: great pleasure princess answer captain gentleman arm walk great stride room crowd servant make eager way bow little princess bed send servant fast horse stable tell king papa royal highness desire presence choose servant wait order room clear

paragraph: "Thank you very much, Sir Walter," said the princess, and her eye glanced toward a rosy-cheeked girl who had lately come to the house as a scullery-maid.
tokens: thank say princess eye glance rosy cheeked girl come house scullery maid

paragraph: But when Lootie saw the eyes of her dear princess going in search of another instead of her, she fell upon her knees by the bedside, and burst into a great cry of distress.
tokens: see eye dear princess go search fall knee bedside burst great cry distress

paragraph: "I think, Sir Walter," said the princess, "I will keep Lootie. But I put myself under your care; and you need not trouble my king-papa until I speak to you again. Will you all please to go away? I am quite safe and well, and I did not hide myself for the sake either of amusing myself, or of troubling my people. Lootie, will you please to dress me?"
